keyFacts: The service request is for a RAID system failure at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York, a federal detention facility.
The failure involved a NICE Vision recording system, and improper drive replacement corrupted the video database, potentially causing data loss.
The incident occurred in August 2019, which is shortly after Jeffrey Epstein's arrest and during his detention at MCC New York.
The document references prior technical correspondence from February 2019 regarding RAID rebuild procedures.
The location (150 Park Row, NY) is the address of the MCC New York, where Epstein was held.
